skillTree.localised_description: The pride of Nehekharan armies, impacting enemy lines with bone-shattering force and grinding the corpses beneath their heavy wheels.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

Undead units cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is broken.
	
	Undead units also have:
	 Fear and Terror Immunity
	
	Undead units may also have their hit points restored by special characters such as the Vampire Counts Necromancer.

skillTree.localised_description: Soaked in and toughened by embalming fluid, the cloth bindings used to mummify afford the wearer additional protection from all but a direct hit from mortal projectiles.
Souls retrieved from the Netherwold and bound to their controller provide a degree of magical resistance.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

skillTree.localised_description: Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say no…

effects.description: When normally killed in action, this Hero will be wounded instead

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type

skillTree.localised_description: Reaching behind the wall of death to bring back the soul and bind it to you takes skill, but like anything, practice makes perfect!
The strength at the base of the pillar; the venom of the cobra and the asp.
Hatred this strong is infectious, contagious, and inescapable.

Necrotects were stern taskmasters who oversaw tens of thousands of Nehekharans as they toiled under the blazing sun. Under their gaze, an army of masons carved huge slabs of rock out of cliff faces before vast columns of slaves dragged the stones across the desert and hauled them into position

attributes.bullet_text: This unit's vigour is less affected by fatiguing actions, such as combat.
This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.

skillTree.localised_description: This intricate hieroglyphic engraving aids the Necrotect's drive to restore his Tomb King's monuments to their former glory.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +8% for Construct units
	(Hero's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The secrets of the desert reveal themselves to the unwary trespasser.

effects.description:
Unit capacity: +1
	Sepulchral Stalkers
	Necropolis Knights
	Necropolis Knights (Halberds)

skillTree.localised_description: Animated by a ceremony of awakening, the Tomb Scorpion's carapace is infused with residual power from the corpse within to swarm and kill the enemies of its master.
The faces of the gods gaze down from their daises, imposing monuments to Nehekhara's former prestige.
The master of the necrotectural art understands all aspects of the construction process; inspiration, labour, time and cost are all within his Undead grasp.

effects.description:
Construction cost: -10% for all buildings
	(local province)

Construction time: -1 for Province Capital/Settlement buildings
	(local province)

skillTree.localised_description: To carve a Necrosphinx is to manifest the greatest and most destructive creature of the underworld. Not all Necrotects were adept at bringing such constructions to Unlife - only the most gifted of their trade even dare.

The leonine statues, known as Warsphinxes, were first constructed in Khemri; and so it is Necrotects who hail from the first city are the greatest carvers of these magnificent and deadly stone beasts.
No expense was spared in sculpting a Hierotitan - the greatest and most talented of Necrotects were contracted to work on the blessed stone that would form these gigantic statues.
It is not possible to defeat such unshakeable spirit once its owner's mind is made up.
Kill many and you *are* a conqueror; godhood is then but a protracted slaughter away...
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
He whose will transcends death can strike out from beyond the grave, to devastating effect.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

skillTree.localised_description: Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Death is not an impedance to the strongest of wills.
Beware the scorpion's sting, hidden 'neath the desert sands yet always poised to strike.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

skillTree.localised_description: Whether it be training harder, travelling lighter, eating less or sleeping better, there's always a way to draw more from the day.

effects.description: Increase Mobility action: Movement range is increased by an additional 5%
Increase Mobility action: Movement range is increased by an additional 10%
Increase Mobility action: Movement range is increased by an additional 15%

skillTree.localised_description: Such magic-users may be wise and able to offer sage advice, especially if they have scried the region.

effects.description: Boost Income action: Income is modified by an additional 2%
Boost Income action: Income is modified by an additional 4%
Boost Income action: Income is modified by an additional 6%

skillTree.localised_description: They cannot stop what they cannot see.

effects.description: Damage Walls action: 1 additional wall breaches
Damage Walls action: 2 additional wall breaches
Damage Walls action: 3 additional wall breaches

skillTree.localised_description: Such a champion will not bend or break, but slay in their Lord's name.

effects.description: Wound action: Additional 5% chance of wounding target
Wound action: Additional 12% chance of wounding target
Wound action: Additional 21% chance of wounding target

skillTree.localised_description: To sow discord and confuse the enemy, sending them down the wrong route or befuddling their senses.

effects.description: Block Army action: Movement range is modified by an additional -3%
Block Army action: Movement range is modified by an additional -8%
Block Army action: Movement range is modified by an additional -15%

skillTree.localised_description: An expert in their craft, this Hero knows all the mistakes that can be made and how to best avoid making them.
These jars contain the remains of many Liche Priests, which are useful for raising and binding a new force.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

Undead units cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is broken.
	
	Undead units also have:
	 Fear and Terror Immunity
	
	Undead units may also have their hit points restored by special characters such as the Vampire Counts Necromancer.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: If you're gonna die, you may as well die with your boots on.
Being fleet of foot is useful in a fight… or when trying to get away afterwards!

related_attributes.bullet_text: Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: The people of the desert live and die by their oaths in Basth's graceful sight.
Benevolent Tahoth imparts sacred knowledge and timeless wisdom to his people.
The Tomb Kings and their servants feel Khsar's wrath coursing through their Unliving veins.
Time itself cannot harm those who have defied death.
That which is sculpted in Qu'aph's noble image strikes with the strength of the Serpent-God.
Djaf's servants bring brutal, jackal-headed death to his unfortunate foes.
The stuff of myth and nightmares made stone, and later terrifying, savage reality.
Imbued with the souls of ancient Liche Priests, Sokth's servants are unhindered by their mechanical bodies of metal and stone.
This Necrotect knows all the secret hieroglyphic inscriptions required to strengthen his statuary constructs.

effects.description:
Recruit rank: +1 for Khemrian Warsphinx and Necrosphinx units
	(local province)

Recruit rank: +1 for Ushabti units
	(local province)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Well built, robust. Powerful.
Rugged, resistant, and almost unbreakable, this being can and will take on all comers.
Deceit is a perfectly acceptable means of attack.

effects.description:
Ambush success chance: +10%
	(armies in local owned region)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: "Revered One, Venerable One, Lord of Secrets, High Priest of the Temple of Years…"

This Necrotect has spent a hundred lifetimes studying the likeness of the Khepra beetle. Building both his skills and accomplishments in the hope that one day he would be granted the finest stone and the most potent of magiks, and be commissioned by a Tomb King to create the most massive of Nehekharan constructs, the Khemric Titan.
Studying and sculpting the deadly nehekharan spitter cobra for centries to please his patron Qu'aph, this Necrotect's knowledge of poisons is unmatched.

Hierotitans were constructed to stand within the uppermost chambers of the Tomb Kings' burial pyramids. Only the most honored and experienced of Necrotects were given the sacred duty of creating the Kings protector while he slept.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +5 for Hierotitan, Necrolith Colossus and Khemric Titan units
	(Hero's army)

Melee defence: +5 for Hierotitan, Necrolith Colossus and Khemric Titan units
	(Hero's army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Bringing Usirian's blessings upon the casket this Necrotect has specialised in creating only the finest ceremonial scorpions for Liche Priests of the Mortuary Cult too physically feeble to carry on.

effects.description:
Speed: +4% for Tomb Scorpion units
	(Hero's army)

Melee attack: +3 for Tomb Scorpion units
	(Hero's army)

Melee defence: +3 for Tomb Scorpion units
	(Hero's army)

Bonus vs Infantry: +4 for Tomb Scorpion units
	(Hero's army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Gaining direct commisions from the Mortuary Cult, this Necrotect's creations are often imbued with the most powerful of their magiks.
This Necrotect is apt to imbue his stone with the darkest of spirits, screaming souls usually reserved for the walking nightmare of the Necrosphinx.

effects.description:
Melee defence: +5 for Necrosphinx units
	(Hero's army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: This Necrotect has concentrated his neverending immortal work to raising the monuments, pyramids and walls of Khemri once again.

effects.description:
Construction cost: -8% for Landmark buildings
	(local region)

Construction cost: -8% for Wall, Garrison, Citadel and Estate buildings
	(local region)

Construction cost: -8% for Wall and Garrison buildings
	(local region)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: This Lybaran Necrotect has specialised in creating the huge Bow of the Deserts, and the giant constructs which wield them.
Prince Rakaph III has commissioned only the finest Necrotects to create his mighty Warsphinx army.

effects.description:
Armour: +5 for Khemrian Warsphinx units
	(Hero's army)

Armour: +6 for Khemrian Warsphinx and Necrosphinx units
	(Hero's army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: The God of the Scorpions protects the venal, the perfidious, and the downright murderous.

effects.description:
Hero action success chance: +3%
	(Heroes in local province)

Melee attack: +3 for Tomb Scorpion units
	(all units in army)

Melee defence: +3 for Tomb Scorpion units
	(all units in army)
